column4: hi i keep getting this error from virtual box when trying to start a os:

VirtualBox kernel driver not installed. The vboxdrv kernel module was either not loaded or /dev/vboxdrv was not created for some reason. Please install the virtualbox-ose-modules package for your kernel, e.g. virtualbox-ose-modules-generic..
you need to install the kernel module for the appropriate kernel. HideousNashimoto .... odd. and DaCapn the user said he has killed firefox already.
how do i determine what kernal modual i need and how to ionstall it?
you need the virtual box module for your kernel. if you go uname -a it should show you a kernel version. install the module for that kernel.
2.6.24-21-rt #1 SMP PREEMPT RT Mon Aug 25 19:24:40 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
only 2 results come up on google for that,do you know where i can find the module?
nothing shows up in synaptic when i search for: 2.6.24-rt
.... its under virtualbox-modules somewhere around there.
it dosent mathc my kernal number exactly,it says:virtualbox-ose-guest module for linux-image-2.6.24-21-rt instead of 2.6.24-rt
i installed the modual rebooted and still have not had any luck getting that to work
